thread.title: Emma Stone and Natalie Portman lead A-list cast for rendition of 'I Will Survive' ahead of Donald Trump's inauguration
thread.title_full: Emma Stone and Natalie Portman lead A-list cast for rendition of 'I Will Survive' ahead of Donald Trump's inauguration

author: Chris Graham
title: Emma Stone and Natalie Portman lead A-list cast for rendition of 'I Will Survive' ahead of Donald Trump's inauguration
text:
Emma Stone and Natalie Portman lead A-list cast for rendition of 'I Will Survive' ahead of Donald Trump's inauguration Natalie Portman takes part in the rendition of I Will Survive Credit: W Magazine/YouTube Chris Graham 13 January 2017 • 4:20am 
N atalie Portman and Emma Stone are among an all-star cast of Hollywood actors who have performed a rendition of "I will Survive" ahead of next week's inauguration of Donald Trump . 
While none of the actors mention the president-elect in the “dramatic interpretation” of the 1979 Gloria Gaynor hit, the magazine that produced the video said it was the "kind of anthem we need now more than ever with the inauguration bearing down on us". 
"With an impending Donald Trump presidency, I will survive,” the magazine said. 
A s well as Portman and Stone, the video features Felicity Jones , Dev Patel, Andrew Garfield, Amy Adams, Matthew McConaughey and many others. 
"This is going to be interesting," Garfield says before the song starts. "It may get too real." 
The performance "is just the antidote for a still-grieving Hollywood, many members of which were outspoken Hillary Clinton supporters over the past year - and a few of whom have found themselves on the unfriendly end of Donald Trump’s Twitter", the magazine wrote. Watch | Meryl Streep attacks Trump in emotional speech 01:51 
A t the Golden Globes earlier this week, Meryl Streep delivered a powerful speech criticising the Republican billionaire , who hit back on Twitter calling the Hollywood veteran an "over-rated ... Hillary flunky". 
The video has drawn a mixed reaction, with almost as many YouTube users disliking it as liking it. 
"Don't worry beautiful millionaire famous celebrities - you'll survive just fine," one user commented.
